greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers that are congruent to {3, 5} mod 8.
comment: Numbers k for which Jacobi symbol J(2,k) = -1, so 2 (as well as 2^k) is not a square mod k. - _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 27 2005, corrected by _Jianing Song_, Nov 05 2019, see also A329095.
Numbers n whose multiplicative order modulo 2^k is 2^(k - 2) for k >= 4. For k = 3, the numbers whose multiplicative order modulo 8 is 2 are in sequence A047484. - _Jianing Song_, Apr 29 2018
link: Muniru A Asiru, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,1,-1).
program: (GAP) a:=[3];; for n in [2..60] do a[n]:=8*n-a[n-1]-8; od; a; # _Muniru A Asiru_, Dec 04 2018
xref: Row 1 of A112070. Complement of A047522 relative to A005408. Primes in this sequence: A003629.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
